question: In a step towards increasing liquidity amidst the Covid-19 pandemic, what is the new reverse repo rate, as notified by the Reserve Bank of India?
explanation:
The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Governor has recently announced that the reverse repo rate has been cut by 25 basis points to 3.75%.
This announcement has been made by the RBI in its efforts towards increasing liquidity amidst the Covid-19 pandemic. As the repo rate has been kept unchanged at 4.4%, the spread between the repo and reverse repo has been widened. This encourages the banks to lend the money instead of parking it with the RBI.
